column4: Hey hawke_, bborkk here.  I figured out the wxPython problem.
Turns out my PYTHONPATH variable wasn't set and wxPython2.4 didn't know how to deal with multiple installs of wxPython without it.
Ah, that makes sense I suppose.  Fun fun.
More fun than I was looking for, but at least everything works now.
inotify is some sort of interrupt handler or something?
I think it's some sort of mechanism where the kernel notifies a process when a file changes.
So you got picard to work?
What is picard?  You mentioned that yesterday.
Oh, n/m then...I figured that's what you were trying to use since you agreed when I mentioned it yesterday.  It's the next-gen musicbrainz tagger application.
It's the only thing I've seen that depends on wxpython2.5.3
Oh, right.  No, I just knew that it was wxPython-based.
I'm writing a couple of things.  One is a featureful low-level serial port terminal.
Another is an interface for monitoring and controlling wireless sensor networks.
Well, hopefully it will be when I'm finished.  :)
